arts.ttl: Ruben Selles hails Hull City's 'big' win at Sheffield Wednesday after thrilling finale
arts.sum: "My feeling was, well, everyone was jumping and in and around, and I immediately needed to think about how do we close the game out," he said. That's the main thing for us and we need to take care of our business, be competitive, take our chances like today, score a goal, get the three points.

arts.ttl: Charlie Hughes steals dramatic win for relegation-battlers Hull over Sheff Wed
arts.sum: The defender scored four minutes into stoppage time with the Tigers three points above the drop zone.

arts.ttl: Charlie Hughes header hands Hull City dramatic victory over Sheffield Wednesday
arts.sum: That goal, in front of 3,000 away fans in Sheffield, sent them wild, but the Tigers needed Ivor Pandur to pull off town huge saves either side of that sensational header to ensure three of the most precious points head back down the M1 and M62 . Coyle was booked for hauling down Bannan after City failed to make the most of an attacking free-kick, and then Pandur made a vital stop from a Shea Charles breakaway, before Matt Crooks came on in stoppage time for Slater.

arts.ttl: Sheffield Wednesday vs Hull City LIVE match updates and reaction from Hillsborough
arts.sum: Listen, as professional footballers, hopefully, they've earned enough they can have a little bit behind them to keep them going for this month until they do sort their pay out, but it's like anything, any walk of life, if somebody's earned their money, they deserve to be paid. We're going to make sure we do the right thing for Sheffield Wednesday; we're going to do the right things for the fans', so hopefully, for City's sake, it's the side where they're a little bit annoyed.

arts.ttl: Hull City dressing room verdict as Tigers prepare for Sheffield Wednesday test
arts.sum: Hull City defender Sean McLoughlin says it's imperative the Tigers bounce back from last weekend's disappointing loss to Luton Town when they face Sheffield Wednesday at Hillsborough on Saturday afternoon. The Tigers' four-game unbeaten run was ended by Alfie Jones' freak own goal against the Hatters and then made even worse on Wednesday night when Derby County beat Preston North End 2-0 to move above City on goals scored, leaving them just a point an place above the drop zone.

arts.ttl: How Sheffield Wednesday's Hillsborough anxieties could play into Hull City's hands - Barry Cooper
arts.sum: Their last three home outings have all ended in defeat to Sheffield United, Sunderland and Coventry City, while the game before that defeat to the Sky Blues was a 1-1 draw with Luton. City have won just four times in front of their own fans this term and Saturday's 1-0 loss to Luton Town ended a mini-revival after successive victories over Plymouth Argyle and Oxford United had raised spirits.

arts.ttl: 'Ridiculous' Hull City point made as Curtis Davies expresses Derby County and Luton Town concern
arts.sum: "Ruben was reasonably consistent in terms of they might lose a game, but they'd bounce back and potentially get a win and get a few points here and there, whereas I thought Derby and Luton were dropping like stones. "Luton have got 10 points from the last five games with the last three points coming here at the MKM with the most unfortunate own goal you're ever going to see.

arts.ttl: ‘He’s seen as a pariah’: how Chansiri’s Sheffield Wednesday reign went sour
arts.sum: With delays in paying players and an owner who has lost the faith of fans, the Championship club urgently need a plan It is highly unlikely a statement including the phrase “impacted on the club’s immediate cashflow” can result in anything positive. Sheffield Wednesday announced their latest financial issues on Monday after failing to pay their players on time at the end of March, putting the Championship side under a dark cloud. This is the latest cause for concern among Owls supporters who have become increasingly frustrated by the ownership of Dejphon Chansiri, and the longer the players are not remunerated the greater the risk of punishment. An English Football League charge could come next week if the players remain unpaid. A fine, transfer ban or points deduction would then be among the options open to the league, which is in dialogue with Wednesday, if the matter is not resolved quickly, which the club is confident it will be. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Hull City's predicted XI to face Sheffield Wednesday as Joao Pedro decision made
arts.sum: Kasey Palmer was handed his first start last weekend and showed glimpses of his ability before running out of steam and coming off, but his return saw Joe Gelhardt pushed wide left in a move which seemed to disrupt the momentum Selles' side had been operating with previously. Hull City head coach Ruben Selles will have another selection dilemma when he sits down to pick his starting XI for Saturday's Yorkshire derby at Sheffield Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Hull City given Championship survival encouragement on eve of huge Sheffield Wednesday showdown
arts.sum: “After their 2-0 win over Preston North End at Pride Park on Wednesday night, Derby County have cut their probability of going down this season by just under 17 per cent, according to our relegation market," Robert Ford from Betfred told Hull Live. According to Betfred, City's odds of going down have gone from 4/1 to 11/2 with a 15.4 per cent chance based on their metrics, but the news is not so bright for Plymouth Argyle, Luton or Oxford United.
